{"step_by_step_thinking": "To differentiate between a dentigerous cyst and an ameloblastoma, multiple methods can be used. Radiographic examination can provide valuable information about the lesion, but it may not be sufficient for a definitive diagnosis. Aspiration cytology can help in obtaining a sample for analysis, but it may not provide a conclusive differentiation between the two conditions. Clinical features alone may not be reliable for distinguishing between a dentigerous cyst and an ameloblastoma. Therefore, the most appropriate method to differentiate between a dentigerous cyst and an ameloblastoma is through microscopic examination. This involves analyzing the histopathological features of the lesion, which can provide definitive information about the nature of the cyst or tumor.", "answer_choice": "C"}
